title: Pappadeaux Fondue
directions: In a saucepan, combine 2 TBLS butter, flour, and onion. Cook over medium heat until onions are tender, about 5 minutes.
Slowly stir in stock and white wine, whisking until smooth.
Add cayenne pepper and salt, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add cream, and simmer 5 minutes more. Remove from heat and set aside.
Melt 1 TBLS butter in a hot saute pan. Saute shrimp in butter about 2 minutes per side.
Add spinach, mushrooms, crab meat and green onions. Saute until mushrooms and spinach soften, about 2 minutes.
Fold into cream sauce and bring to a simmer.
Add half of the grated mozzarella. Simmer another couple of minutes so the cheese melts.
Slowly add xanthun gum as needed to thicken. (A little goes a long way. Don't overuse.)
Pour mixture into a heatproof dish (or two). Top with remaining grated cheese.
Place under a broiler until cheese melts, about 3-4 minutes.
Top with chives if desired and serve immediately with garlic bread OR pork skins for keto.
ingredients: 3 TBLS all-purpose flour OR almond flour
½ cup chicken stock (or fish stock for extra fish flavor)
12 raw shrimp, peeled and deveined, cut in half
¼ tsp Blackening seasoning (store-bought or make your own)
1 large handful of chopped fresh spinach
½ tsp xanthun gum (+ a tiny bit more if needed for thickening)
